fields.description:
In my 2.5 installation, I created a page for wiki administrators that listed online users, using the following macro:
{userlister:online=true}

But, when I upgraded to version 2.7, I get the following error message on my wiki page:
Please specify a value for 'group' or 'groups'.

The wiki notation help (when in the Wiki Markup editor) does not list "group" or "groups" as a required parameter. I looked in the documentation, and the documentation does now list it as a required parameter.

When I write the macro as follows:
{userlister:groups=*|online=true}
I get a list of all users in the system (both online and offline).
fields.summary: Userlister macro no longer seems to work if you don't supply a "group" parameter

fields.description:
When I have a flat LDAP server with all groups residing under the O=LOGITECH organization, Confluence sees all users added into the group.  It also see's all global users in all domains below that including AM, TW, IE, etc.  The problem is that even though the Confluence user group in LDAP has all the users in it, users are given an error "You are not permitted to perform this operation" when logging in.

Confluence needs to be able to see groups off the root organization.

Please see this case for more information:

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-14600

We have implemented a band aid using the script that makes it so whenever a user attempts to login that user is then immediately added to the local confluence-users group and allowed to log in.  This is less than ideal since it does not allow us to control user access to the system.  The confluence group in LDAP is no longer used.
fields.summary: LDAP Integration on flat domains

fields.description:
I'm working on an integration project to manage groups for users in Confluence. I'm able to define groups, add groups, get a users groups, etc... but the one thing that is missing is being able to get all users in a specific group. Here at Rambus, they have groups for each manager (they contain their subordinates). When a manager quits or leaves, the subordinates all get reassigned to the new manager and get removed from the old manager group via my integration. There is nothing in the raw data that feeds the integration that says "a manager quit"... I just get a different set of Groups for the given set of users. Example, some one moves out of Testing and into Support, they get a new manager and the integration will remove the user from the old manager and add the the new manager (note that nobody quit... its just a different group assignment). The problem is that I don't have an easy to know when a group is empty and I can delete it as ongoing maintenance (i.e a manager quits and nobody will ever be in that group again). They have dozens and dozens of groups so ongoing it will become an issue with all kinds of empty groups of terminated managers. If there was a 
    Vector getAllUsersForGroup(String token, String groupName)
method, that would solve the issue. I could use a getGroups call in conjunction with getAllUsersForGroup to perform the ongoing maintenance without any admin/UI interaction (what Rambus is looking for... let the integration project manage all that stuff without any administrator maintenance). Thanks for the help.
fields.summary: get all users in a group from the Remote API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10428].
  {panel}

If I create an EventListener plugin and listen for AttachmentViewEvent.class, when the event comes in I have no way of figuring out any of the following context details:

* HTTP Session ID
* Authenticated User
* Browser User Agent
* URL
* Query String
* Referrer
* Remote IP
* Forwarded For (HTTP Header)
* (everything you get to via HttpServletRequest really)

What would be ideal is if the HttpServletRequest could be tacked onto the Event so that this detail could be logged. If a WebWork action was being used to serve the resource (like the rest of Confluence uses) we would already have access via the same mechanism used there using ServletActionContext.getRequest(). It would also give plugin authors more flexibility in that regard too!
fields.summary: Event Listeners listening to AttachmentViewEvent can't find out the username / context / session

fields.description:
The feed builder sets the sort order (created/modified) in ListQuery#statusList, but that isn't ever used by the SmartListManager for anything, so it's ignored in the search.

Then, on the way back, the sort order is used to decide which date (created or modified) into entry.setPublishedDate(), which presumably affects sort order in some newsreaders. This is wrong data, though, we should always put the published date in setPublishedDate(), and the most recent modification date in setUpdatedDate().
fields.summary: Feed builder sort option doesn't seem to do what it should be doing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10412].
  {panel}

Implement a real substring search. It is not possible to place "*substring" search. 
This is very annoying not to be able to find topics only because the searched term is started with a prefix (e.g. There is no chance to find a topic about WinCVS jsut by searching for "CVS" or "*CVS". 

If it is not possible by default, why it cannot be enabled by some macro or optional plugin?

(Related terms to help with visibility: prefixed search, suffixed search, starts with)
fields.summary: Support substring (partial) searches for terms used in Confluence: page title, attachment names, etc.

fields.description:
Hi,

Do the following step for reproducing the issue:
1. Go to permissions and click on 'Edit permission'.  Now enter the username in Individual users permission.  say my username is: vtest  .. But while entering in the box I entered as Vtest (V- capital) and clicked on the 'Add' button.
Note:- I have not choose user from 'Find group'.. I have directly added the username in the textbox.
2. Now click 'Save All'...
3. Now you will find that the User get's added to the individual list, but having no permission (check the attached image).
Now when you again clicked on Edit permission.. it shows the view permission selected, but No permission after saving it.

If you uncheck all the permissions .. then also the user is displaying in the list with no permission ( Actually it must get disapper from their)

Cause of error: (I find it)--
 due to entering username in Capital letter (here is..V ), it must be entered as 'vtest'.

My query/issues are:-
1. If we are entering username in Capital then also it must take the correct user.
2. After removing the permission then it get disapper from the permission list... ( Now how can I remove it from my list.. I don't know.. :( ... 


Regards,
- Vishal

fields.description:
Currently, http://support.atlassian.com is running under Tomcat web application server and it's configured with UTF-8 encoding. However, http://confluence.atlassian.com is running under Resin and the URIEncoding is omitted. That's why the browser is not decoded properly when accessing http://confluence.atlassian.com

Detailed explanation for this issue described here:

* http://yi.wiktionary.org/wiki/project:l%C9%9B%CA%81i_%D7%9C%D7%A2%D7%A8%D7%99_%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%99%D7%A0%D7%94%D7%90%D7%A8%D7%98/support.atlassian.com/CSP-14385?uselang=en#globalWrapper
fields.summary: Explanation needed for character encoding usage in CAC and SAC

fields.description:
Hi,

I've encountered a problem similar to this one, except the problem affects images which are not 'thumbnailed'.
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-3366

Steps to reproduce:
1. Attach an image to a CAC page (new or existing)
2. Remove attached image, e.g. 'test.png'
3. Attach new image with the same name, e.g. 'test.png' (using attach image function on Edit screen for the page)
4. Old image still appears on the page.

If I 'Clear Private Data' (ctrl-shirt-del in firefox) after removing the old image, then the new image will be attached correctly.

Cheers,
Andrew
fields.summary: Replacing an image with an image of the same name does not attach new image

fields.summary: Search tab in Page Picker launched from Edit Attachment Screen does not list favourite spaces in drop down

fields.description:
Whenever I go to uninstall or upgrade  plugins (any of them), I get the following message:

_This Pluginloader has no memory of deploying the plugin you are trying to remove: [<pluginname>]_

I discovered this problem when I realized that the calendars I created with the Calendar plugin failed to load properly.  For example, it would show the calendar, but the calendar would not load the data (even after waiting >15 minutes).  When I would click on the "settings" button for the calendar, I'd receive a system error:

Cause:
com.opensymphony.xwork.config.ConfigurationException: There is no Action mapped for namespace /users and action name editmycalendarsettings
 at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxy.(DefaultActionProxy.java:72)

Any other button on the calendar would give me two prompts
1. The Operation Failed
2. There was an error on the server.  Please check your server logs for details.

I thought uninstalling and reinstalling the plug-in may solve this problem, but then I found I could not delete this or any plugin to reinstall it or upgrade it.

*Note* that before this point, I have been receiving intermittent errors with plugins, giving me system errors.  Many of the errors vanished after logging out and logging back into confluence.  We recently upgraded from an earlier version of confluence, and I have been working with many new plugins.  The calendar plugin was one of these, and it worked for the first week or two we were testing it.  It was just recently that I started having problems with it.
fields.summary: Cannot Uninstall or Upgrade Plugins

I edit a page in rich text editor. I insert a new link using the link icon. I select a page from another space fom the History list. The link is created in the text. Saving the page the link points to the page of the selected title but in the space where the source page is.

Doing the same in wiki markup mode work as expected.

Inserting the link in the rich text editing as described above and instead of saving I switch to wiki markup mode clearly displays that the space prefix "spaceid:" is missing from the link.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10358].
  {panel}

Hi,

The Confluence NTLM plugin enables the following authentication scenario:
 
    * A user in a Windows domain logs into the Windows network, using their Active Directory username/password.
    * Then, when they open Confluence in an Internet Explorer browser, they are seamlessly logged into Confluence.
 
Can this scenario be done using only Crowd ( without  Confluence NTLM plugin from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/NTLM+Authenticator+for+Confluence ) ?
 
thanks for any ideas

ivo
fields.summary: confluence authentication via NTLM ( without Confluence NTLM plugin )

fields.description:
We need to dramatically improve the quality of our install and configuration documentation that is seen and used by our new customers.

We did a great job with improving the templates for our release notes and I would love to see us take a similar approach to our core 'getting started' documentation (install guides, admin guides, etc.).

Guidelines for the improvements are:

 - the pages need to be much more readable. They are currently laborious to read;
 - remove the comments (and factor of the useful ones in :) )
 - create easy to follow sections (numbered sections perhaps?)
 - create clear buttons to proceed to next phases of the documentation (look at the poor quality of the next links on the Confluence Installation Guide below the Standalone and EAR/WAR tables
 - encourage users to evaluate using the standalone version until they are satisfied with the product functionality
 - direct users to commonly performed tasks
 -- setting the application as a service
 -- setting up LDAP integration
 - we should consider having two install guides (one for simple evaluations, and another for production ready evaluations)
 - the setup and install guides should most likely be combined
 - moving to the next logical part of the documentation versus moving to a potentially related area (as denoted by the Other Topics and Related Topics headings) should be represented as clearly different types of paths
 - the Security Warning seems over the top and serves to cause confusion and hassle more than any practical value (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Setup+Guide)
 - use more screenshots and visuals, especially when discussing retrieving license keys
 - the process to retrieve evaluation keys has changed, this needs to be updated on relevant pages e.g. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Standard+Installation
 - some pages seem to be very short. It would perhaps be wiser to have longer pages that require less page loading and clicking e.g. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Standard+Installation
fields.summary: Update the Confluence installation and setup documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10354].
  {panel}

In the default Tomcat distribution, and JIRA Standalone, there is a commented-out AJP connector:

{code:xml}
        <!-- To connect to an external web server (typically Apache) -->
        <!-- Define an AJP 1.3 Connector on port 8009 -->
        <!--
            <Connector port="8009" 
              enableLookups="false" redirectPort="8443" protocol="AJP/1.3" />
          -->
{code}

This has been removed from Confluence Standalone.

I think it should be re-added (perhaps using port 8010 to avoid conflicts with JIRA), since AJP is a) required for connecting to IIS, b) the simplest way to get SSL working, c) regaining traction now that mod_proxy_ajp is bundled with major distributions.
fields.summary: Include commented-out AJP connector in Confluence Standalone distribution

fields.description:
Copying a page from a space to another space allows duplicate page names.

# Copy *MyPage* from *Space1* to *Space2* again, with *Parent1* using the copy feature at info tab. *Parent1* now lists two duplicate "Copy of MyPage" pages as child pages.

In this case, Confluence allow duplicate page name between two spaces.

fields.description:
All our calls to retrieve email/establish a connection to the Mail Server do not specify a timeout for the connection. The default behavior is to block indefinitely; if this happens, all resources associated with that thread are never released. This is responsible for https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-14098 as we obtain a cluster wide lock and do not release until the mail is retrieved. No doubt other bugs exist.

*User Symptoms:* Confluence performance degrades over time, particularly during load.  A restart resolves the issue temporarily.  A thread dump while Confluence is slow shows many threads waiting on mail connections
fields.summary: Mail connections do not specify a timeout, leading to monopolization of resources

fields.description:
On the issue regarding certain IP addresses not working for the clustering, we talked to our Cisco support group and they came back with the following:

'It looks like for the non-working address (225.137.66.56) the last IGMP message was CHANGE_TO_EXCLUDE_MODE which will block the IGMP traffic for the group. For the working address 23.0.0.5 the last one was CHANGE_TO_INCLUDE_MODE which forward traffic to the mcast group. Could you please check with the multicast test software provider ?'

Any idea why one address would use TYPE - CHANGE_TO_EXCLUDE_MODE?
fields.summary: Certain Multicast IP addresses sending CHANGE_TO_EXCLUDE_MODE causing IGMP traffic to be blocked

fields.description:
I can map successfully to confluence using either MS Web Folders or DataFreeway. I can access the files via openoffice or notepad but only up to opening them in read only mode.
Double click on a webdav file does not open them automatically.

In [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/WebDAV+Client+Compatibility|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/WebDAV+Client+Compatibility] it was mentioned that editing content (word/excel) is supported, but it seems not the case.

Hence, to make changes to webdav files, I need to copy them locally then re-upload it.
Here's the changes that I can make via MS Web Folders:
* Open a file in read only mode via an application like OpenOffice or notepad or MS Paint.
* Drag and drop. Cutting a webdav file to local hard drive does not delete the webdav file.
* Deleting a file
* Create/Delete a new folder
* Rename a file/folder through a right button click
* Changes to the content of a file can only be done via file upload to replace the older copy

Cheers
Roy
fields.summary: Unable to edit file via WebDav
help files (.chm files) are not searchable

fields.description:
Have a cluster with two nodes. When viewing a group on one node, the members show up properly, however when viewing the group on the second node it returns no users. 

By turning the cache off in atlassian-user.xml, i.e. changing 
{code:xml}
<hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository"  description="Hibernate Repository" cache="true"/>
{code}
to 
{code:xml}
<hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository"  description="Hibernate Repository"/>
{code}

Then things work normally and both nodes return the users when viewing a group. 

Steps to reproduce. 

1) Set up a confluence 2 node cluster, check that it works
2) Integrate with LDAP (but leave groups to be managed internally within confluence)
3) Add some of the LDAP users to confluence-users
4) View the group confluence-users on one of the nodes. 
5) View the group confluence-users on the other node. 

One should return no users, even though the other node displays the users within a group properly.
fields.summary: Viewing the members of a group in a clustered environment works only on one node and not the other.
Edit permissions on page information tab omits space editing restrictions

fields.description:
When using the blog-posts macro with content=excerpts option, the display of a blog post can show wiki markup if the blog post contains a macro whose content falls within the default text cut off for excerpts.

For example, my blog-posts macro declaration looks like this:
\{blog-posts:time=7d|spaces=@all|labels=broadcast|content=excerpts\}

This displays a news item excerpt that contains three HTML links in the form: \[2CHLJ|http://host:port/s/lookup?bug_number=2CHLJ\]. The first two are shown correctly (as outbound links) in the blog post listing, but the third link shows a subset of the wiki link notation specified above. I think this is because the default blog-post excerpt text length falls within the text inside the macro.

The default excerpt length for the blog-posts macro should count text after all wiki markup is evaluated to HTML, rather than internal macro text.
fields.summary: When blog-posts macro displays excerpts, display problem if the blog post contains macro text at the default excerpt point

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10314].
  {panel}

While Geronimo server startup, Bean Scripting Framework (BSF) tag library descriptor that included in bsf-2.3.0.jar isn't parsed correctly and Confluence startup fails.
The root cause is that the element "short-name" value in the BSF tld contains a half space character.

Related information:
Apache Geronimo User ML - deploying BIRT sample in AG V2,0 M6 fails
http://www.nabble.com/deploying-BIRT-sample-in-AG-V2-2C0-M6-fails-to12013748s134.html

I recommend that BSF taglib binary (bsf-2.3.0.jar) should be rebuilt.

Thanks,
Kan Ogawa
fields.summary: Parsing BSF tag library descriptor fails on the Apache Geronimo 2.x server.
